7.75 minimum wage or,

that's not a living

raising wages is

it helps every worker for the basics, basically
the workers that are here.
Now when someone can afford the basics that means that they can

Make higher profits hire more workers,

the raising wages for state employees is good for the economy.

sector workers make too
much.

[LAUGH]
>> We know that that's not right,
in North Carolina, public
sector workers earn about 150 an hour less than their private sector

North Carolina workers on average make about
$2 less an hour than everybody else in the rest of the country,
rest of the national average.
So raising wages for state employees is one key way that our General

One of the last tools that are left and HB two took another tool

this is one last chance
for, this General Assembly to raise wages for North Carolina workers.
Now we also hear and our representative spoke to this,
we also hear

and it is, questionable
that is true, it is only true because the decision that were made

those decisions over the

most of which,
are headquartered out of state,
have not been creating jobs in North

to stop tax cuts
for millionaires and highly profitable corporations and instead
